git_rationale.root_cause: Step 20 'Handle User Refinements' was too brief (51 total lines, 11 lines of actual instructions per Type 1 refinement)
git_rationale.root_cause_commit: Phase 6 refinement loop added without granular step decomposition following established patterns
git_rationale.why_issue_occurred: Brevity caused AI to interpret refinement handling as 'optional detail'. When user asked 'spa呢？哪一家？', orchestrator saw brief Type 1 action list (6 bullet points) and shortcut to manual WebSearch/gaode-maps instead of following proper Task tool delegation to entertainment-agent. Contrast: /ask command Step 6 multi-turn dialogue loop has 80+ lines with explicit sub-phases, preventing skipping.
git_rationale.comparison_baseline: /ask command Step 6: 80+ lines, 6 detailed sub-phases, explicit delegation patterns → AI follows correctly
git_rationale.how_fix_addresses_root:
Expanded Step 20 (Phase 6) from 51 lines to 351 lines with 11 numbered sub-steps (20.1-20.11), each 20-40 lines with:
1. Explicit actions (not suggestions)
2. Concrete examples (spa refinement → entertainment-agent delegation)
3. Verification checkpoints (4-item checklist in Step 20.6)
4. Critical warnings (⚠️ DO NOT MANUALLY RESEARCH in Steps 20.5 and 20.6)
5. Complete Task tool invocation templates with full prompt examples
6. Todo checklist integration (Steps 10-18 added to plan.py)
7. Root cause reference at top of Step 20 explaining why expansion was needed
Granularity (6.9x expansion) makes it impossible for AI to skip delegation step.

design_decisions.why_11_substeps: Mirrors /ask command's Step 6 multi-turn dialogue loop granularity. Each sub-step addresses specific phase: parse → classify → delegate → validate → present. Prevents AI from 'jumping ahead' to solution without proper delegation.
design_decisions.why_explicit_warnings: User reported orchestrator manually researching (anti-pattern). Explicit ⚠️ CRITICAL warnings in Steps 20.5 and 20.6 make delegation non-negotiable.
design_decisions.why_verification_checkpoint: 4-item checklist in Step 20.6 forces orchestrator to self-verify delegation occurred before proceeding. Each checkbox must be checked or execution halts.
design_decisions.why_todo_integration: Refinement was invisible in todo checklist. Adding Steps 10-18 ensures TodoWrite tracks refinement sub-phases, making them 'real' workflow steps AI cannot skip.
design_decisions.why_integer_numbering: Dev agent standards prohibit decimal step numbering (no 20.1.1, 20.1.2). Used 20.1, 20.2, ..., 20.11 instead for compatibility with QA validation.
